decks.notes: This deck focuses on using creature toolbox cards to search for and play specific creatures to create powerful combos and control the board. It utilizes a mix of utility creatures, mana dorks, and protection spells to efficiently search for and play key cards like Delighted Halfling and Springheart Nantuko. With the ability to tutor for creatures and disrupt opponents with cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to assemble powerful combinations quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The mana base includes a variety of lands to support the deck's diverse needs and ensure consistency in executing its game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage to outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counter magic and removal, while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, it has a win condition in Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Flame of Anor to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. The deck also has a balanced mana base to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources through various hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also aims to eliminate threats on the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Damnation. The deck utilizes graveyard synergies with cards like Malakir Rebirth and Necrodominance, as well as card advantage with abilities like March of Wretched Sorrow and Grief. The creatures in the deck, such as Boggart Trawler and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, provide additional value and control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to slow down the opponent while building up a mana base using UrzaTron lands. Once the deck has established board control, it can drop big threats like Emrakul, the World Anew and Devourer of Destiny to close out the game. The overall goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent by utilizing strong control elements and powerful finishers.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures that can quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to use efficient creatures like Wild Nacatl and Territorial Kavu, along with powerful spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt to control the board and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. By using a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide powerful threats, while cards like Static Prison and Unstable Amulet disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. By combining efficient creatures with disruptive elements, this deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays combined with the Cascade mechanic to flood the board with creatures quickly. By casting spells with Cascade, the deck can potentially play additional spells for free, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats. Cards like Laelia, the Blade Reforged and Crashing Footfalls work together to create a fast and powerful board presence. The inclusion of control elements like Force of Negation and Teferi, Time Raveler help to protect the deck's strategy and maintain momentum. The goal is to outpace and overpower the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. The main goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed for a powerful turn, where cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes recursion with cards like Past in Flames to continue the combo if necessary. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and finish them off in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. Scion of Draco provides a powerful flying threat while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to protect your creatures and keep the board under control. The deck also includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, along with counter spells like Force of Negation and Counterspell to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast threats and efficient interaction.

The deck focuses on using a toolbox of creatures to assemble combos and control the game's tempo. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga, the deck can search for key pieces like Delighted Halfling, Nadu, Winged Wisdom, and Springheart Nantuko to create powerful synergies and win conditions. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper provide protection for your combo pieces, while cards like The One Ring and Malevolent Rumble offer disruption and removal options. The deck also includes land cards that provide utility and mana fixing to support its game plan.

Utilize Eldrazi creatures and powerful control spells to disrupt opponents' strategies and overwhelm them with powerful threats. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with mana rocks and Eldrazi Temple, then cast big threats like Emrakul and Ulamog to close out the game. Through the Breach provides a surprise factor, and cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command help control the board and disrupt opponents' hands. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and enable casting the deck's powerful spells.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Grief, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push. It aims to apply pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters, while also utilizing the powerful Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for a strong finish. The deck is designed to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly building a threatening board presence to close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through low-cost spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to win the game as quickly as possible by overwhelming the opponent with early pressure and burn spells. The inclusion of cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart allow for consistent damage output while maintaining a low mana curve. Additionally, the use of Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble provide extra card advantage and graveyard interaction to keep the aggression going. This deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through countering spells and controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt. It also includes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to control the game tempo and win through incremental advantage while denying the opponent key resources. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw to control the game while setting up win conditions like Flame of Anor and Invert Polarity.
